description: This course immediately precedes SWRK 380. The course provides
an overview of how structural oppression across cultural positions (e.g. race, sexuality,
ability, class) may affect client systems. Students integrate awareness, knowledge, and
skills for engaging in anti-oppressive, inclusive practice with individuals, families,
groups, organizations, and communities. This includes role plays assisting clients who
are challenged by oppression as part of their presenting problems and brief immersions
with diverse communities. Offered annually in September. Also counts toward race and ethnic
studies major and concentration. For senior majors only. Prerequisite: SWRK 261
